description.narrative:
Undisrupted Voice project aims to contribute to gender equality through, promotion of personal economic freedoms for young women, protection against all forms of aggression and sexism within the photograph and music field. The changes that the Project seek to seeat the end, include increased in number of young women in photograph and music field as part of paid economic activity at least by 10% from 2021 to end of 2023, the overall goal is to have equal representation within the sector.
The grant applied to D.I.D will support the implementation of Undisrupted Voice project. This project will support the organization to change the narrative and assumption about sexism and gender discrimination within the sector that limit young women’s involvement andfreedom of being economic independent in the field. Last but not least the project intends to see non-violence, sexism against young women in the field, this canbe seen through equal distribution of opportunities and participation in the economy throughphotograph and music.
The activities that will be implemented in this project include: the project will organize a high-profile local symposium with faith leaders, decision and policy makers in the field, arts and music council leaders and register. Secondly, emerging and start-up young women in photographer aged 18 - 35 years will be capacitated with necessary skills required. Awareness Approach - Campaign: The project intends toorganize a documented series of local symposium that bring together allthe named actors above. Also, organize both offline and online campaign against sexism and gender discrimination on photograph and music field. Learning and Amplification approach: A short film including of emerging and start-up women in photograph and music industry aged 18 – 35 years, faith leaders, professional photographers, curators, and feminist will be produced.

participating-org.narrative:
CDF is a registered non-profit organization that works to promote and reinforce the rights of Vulnerable children, particularly girls, by placing children’s legal and human rights on the public agenda, creating working forums to empower children, families and society in general and developing the capacity and skills to address harmful traditional . CDF focuses on child rights protection mainly FGM, child marriage and child Pregnancy. CDF Overall Goal: Socially and economically independent children capable of positively contributing towards the development of Tanzania.
From 2016 CDF started implementation of its 2016 - 19 Strategic Plan. The overall goal of the SP is to ensure that, children are independently and positively capable of contributing towards the social and economic development of Tanzania. The Strategic plan has four thematic areas; Girls Empowerment, Children Protection and Participation, Men and Boys engage and Organization Development, Growth and sustainability.
Diversity Initiative for Development Tanzania started as amovement in 2016, the movement was established by a group of eight Tanzanians of different expertise (majority being community development professionals) aiming to work with young women. The movement by then was advocating for young women rights in various Universities. The movement focused on gender discrimination and supported unprevailed girls and boy in the orphanage centers through capacity building, service provision and mental health support through sports and fun activities at the centers. The on-going challenges around gender equality, human rights violation and the challenge of the fundamental rights and freedom of young women inspired the movement to expand its capacity and engaged different stakeholder to contribute to the cause. Immediate after amendment in NGOs policy in 2019, which required all unregistered movement to be registered under NGO Act, the movement had to officially registered in 2020 under NGO Act of 2002 as a non-governmental organization, which use a strong diversity and inclusion strategy to advocate and lobby for Women and Youth’s fundamental rights and freedom in order to develop equal opportunities for all in the society. Since its establishment Diversity Initiative seeks to ensure the fundamental rights and freedom of women and youth are respected and equally guaranteed without discrimination through promotion of social welfare and policies favoring equal economic and political opportunity, improving life ofyouth and women by enhancing access to education opportunities, and promote legal and policy reforms that envisions the best interest of youth and women.
Children Dignity Forum Diversity Initiatives for Developme
